metadata.synopsis: The players have agreed to help the Harpers ambush a caravan of Absolute cultists and prisoners. You've just arrived at the ambush site - the mood is tense, words are spoken in harsh whispers. When the Caravan arrives there's a monsterous drider at its head, muttering to itself, talking to an imaginary queen/majesty that represents the voice of his God, The Absolute. The player can try to trick the drider into handing over its magic lantern (the Moonlantern - a glowing lantern hanging from the end of a staff), although that could leave the drider exposed to the worst effects of the curse. Will likely end in combat, either because you signaled the Harpers to spring their ambush or because the drider got suspicious and attacked.

60.speaker: Kar'niss
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player moves into the light. Player's positioning should match N218 so it merges into the rest of the dialog flow

68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player moves into the light. Player's positioning should match N218 so it merges into the rest of the dialog flow

71.speaker: Kar'niss
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player moves into the light. Player's positioning should match N218 so it merges into the rest of the dialog flow

70.speaker: Kar'niss
70.text: Step into the light! Let us see you.
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player moves into the light. Player's positioning should match N218 so it merges into the rest of the dialog flow

99.text: *Your minds connect and you hear a voice whispering to you. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the darkness?*
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player moves into the light. Player's positioning should match N218 so it merges into the rest of the dialog flow

62.text: *Your minds connect and you hear a voice whispering to you. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the darkness?*

90.speaker: Narrator
90.text: *Your minds connect and you hear a voice whispering to you. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the darkness?*

65.text: One of your True Souls, my Queen! How have they survived?
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scuttles forward, holding the lantern to illuminate the player's face

12.speaker: Kar'niss
12.text: One of your True Souls, my Queen! How have they survived?
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scuttles forward, holding the lantern to illuminate the player's face

43.speaker: Kar'niss
43.text: You blessed them too, my Queen? Where is their lantern?

50.speaker: Player
50.text: The Absolute guided me here. She said a mere drider was not worthy - that I must take your lantern.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Our wondrous Queen dropped me a message - she said you need to give me that lantern. It's very important.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: You're holding my lantern. The Absolute said you had to give it to me.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: The Absolute guided me to you. She said I was to take yours.

100.speaker: Kar'niss
100.text: But majesty, you gave this lantern to me. You said it was mine!

42.text: But majesty, you gave this lantern to me. You said it was mine!

51.speaker: Kar'niss
51.text: But majesty, you gave this lantern to me. You said it was mine!

47.speaker: Kar'niss
47.text: No, we will keep your gift and drive this false one back into the dark!

108.speaker: Player
108.text: I would use True Soul Nere's lantern, but it broke.

105.speaker: Kar'niss
105.text: Nere? A fickle, unworthy servant to our Queen.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Lantern? Is that what protects you out here?
39.context: NodeContext: 'Sacred light' referring to the Moonlantern

83.speaker: Kar'niss
83.text: Our goddess protects us. We carry her sacred light to drive back the shadows.
83.context: NodeContext: 'Sacred light' referring to the Moonlantern

87.speaker: Kar'niss
87.text: Yes, majesty, your light can shield another of your faithful. They will join us on the road.
87.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in angerNodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in anger

32.speaker: Player
32.text: No - that lantern is mine, by order of the Absolute. Give it - now.
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in angerNodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in anger

3.speaker: Kar'niss
3.text: Majesty? Is - is this true? Did I not serve you well?
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in angerNodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in anger

20.speaker: Kar'niss
20.text: Majesty? Is - is this true? Did I not serve you well?
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in angerNodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in anger

24.speaker: Kar'niss
24.text: Very well. If it is your will, they can have it.
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in angerNodeContext: Drider throws the Moonlantern to the ground in anger

109.text: So how does this work, exactly?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: So how does this work, exactly?

13.speaker: Kar'niss
13.text: They don't know? Our Queen told them nothing?

0.speaker: Kar'niss
0.text: She has blessed the lantern's light. It is the Absolute who protects us from the shadows.
0.context: NodeContext: Stress on first word. "*She* has blessed this light."

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Protects us from what? What are the shadows, exactly?

33.speaker: Kar'niss
33.text: Simply shadows. Cursed, hungry shadows, trying to grab the living. And they are getting stronger.

97.speaker: Kar'niss
97.text: But do not worry, there is still power in the lantern. Our queen will protect you, as she protected me.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Indeed, it's time for you to go.

10.speaker: Kar'niss
10.text: This is not her Majesty's will.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: I am both a True Soul and a cleric. I've blessed you with the power of the Absolute - you'll be safe.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Securus! There - you now carry the blessing of the Absolute. You'll be safe.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Vale, idiotae! There - you now carry the blessing of the Absolute. You'll be safe.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: (Wave hands.) There - you now carry the blessing of the Absolute. You'll be safe.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: The Absolute has blessed you. You will be safe.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: The Absolute wants you to go. Now!

79.speaker: Kar'niss
79.text: If - if it is her majesty's will...

22.speaker: Kar'niss
22.text: If - if it is her majesty's will...

85.speaker: Kansif
85.text: You can't be serious. You know what's out there-

63.speaker: Kar'niss
63.text: IF IT IS HER MAJESTY'S WILL, THEN WE SHALL WALK!

106.speaker: Kar'niss
106.text: She will protect us. She - she must.

29.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The HALF-ORC shoots you a dirty look, but follows the DRIDER into the darkness, along with the other cultists. There is silence for a beat before screams start to pierce the air. There is sound of a brief battle. 

To account for Vez being dead or alive we will rely on a Show Actor key in Node N858.

58.speaker: Kar'niss
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Off screen, cries from the darkness, which fade to an eerie silence.NodeContext: Off screen, being killed by shadow monsters. He cries out, begging his god to save him, but it's too late

30.text: *As the sounds fade, there is nothing left but cold, still silence.*

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *As the sounds fade, there is nothing left but cold, still silence.*

28.text: They think us fools, Majesty. They think we cannot see through their lies.

1.speaker: Kar'niss
1.text: They think us fools, Majesty. They think we cannot see through their lies.

17.speaker: Kar'niss
17.text: We will punish them for this blasphemy. We will make them scream!

37.speaker: Player
37.text: If we in the Underdark, I would split you open, drider. Leave before I change my mind.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Question me again, and I will make drag you into the darkness - screaming.

72.text: But majesty, you gave this lantern to me. You said it was mine!

54.speaker: Kar'niss
54.text: But majesty, you gave this lantern to me. You said it was mine!

15.speaker: Kar'niss
15.text: No, we will keep your gift and drive this false one back into the dark!

40.speaker: Player
40.text: That lantern is mine - by order of the Absolute. Drop it, or I'll shatter your spine as the wind breaks a twig.
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider turns and starts to leave, ready to head into the dark. You're expected to follow.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: That lantern is mine - by order of the Absolute. Drop it, or I'll boil your brain inside your skull.
98.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider turns and starts to leave, ready to head into the dark. You're expected to follow.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: The Absolute has asked me to carry the lantern. Hand it over.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider turns and starts to leave, ready to head into the dark. You're expected to follow.

73.speaker: Player
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider turns and starts to leave, ready to head into the dark. You're expected to follow.

52.speaker: Kar'niss
52.text: They will follow close. Do not leave the light!
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider turns and starts to leave, ready to head into the dark. You're expected to follow.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Or I could kill you and take that light.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Never mind me, how have you survived the curse?

101.speaker: Kar'niss
101.text: To have a rage so fierce the dark quivers - you must have blessed them, my Queen! But if so... where is their lantern?

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I am not one of hers - divine light guides my footfall.

56.speaker: Kar'niss
56.text: There is but one god - and she is Absolute.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Takes more than shadows to put someone like me down.

6.speaker: Kar'niss
6.text: A mere mortal warrior could have never persevered alone... Ah! Of course!

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I have tested my mind and body beyond to its absolute limits - I do not fear the darkness.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: With the aid of my mind and my magic, for I am a master of both.

84.speaker: Kar'niss
84.text: Magic alone could never have persevered... Ah! Of course!

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I swore an oath - a powerful one. It will take more than darkness to end me.

59.speaker: Kar'niss
59.text: Ah, you swore an oath to my Queen! But if so... where is their lantern?

55.speaker: Player
55.text: You know what they say - a ballad a day, keeps the darkness away!

8.speaker: Kar'niss
8.text: To make the darkness quiver with mere song - you must have blessed them, my Queen. But if so... where is their lantern?

69.speaker: Player
69.text: No higher forces protect me - I survived by my own tenacity.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I am a guardian of nature - and in return nature protects me.

31.speaker: Kar'niss
31.text: But the druids have no power here, not since... Ah, of course!

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Navigating dangerous terrain is second nature to me.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I burn with pure arcana - how on earth do you survive?
